title: 1. Land use mapping using TWDTW-1NN and stars
text: First, let’s read set training samples come dtwSat package installation.
code: library(dtwSat)  samples <- st_read(system.file("mato_grosso_brazil/samples.gpkg", package = "dtwSat"), quiet = TRUE)

what: Preparing the Satellite Image Time Series
title: 1. Land use mapping using TWDTW-1NN and stars
text: dtwSat package supports satellite images read R using stars package. installation comes set MOD13Q1 images region within Brazilian Amazon. Note timing crucial TWDTW distance metric. create consistent image time series, start extracting date acquisition MODIS file names (Didan 2015). Side note: date file name true acquisition date pixel. MOD13Q1 16-day composite product, date file name first day 16-day period. files dates hand, can construct stars satellite image time series dtwSat. Note ’s important set date observation using parameter along. produce 4D array (data-cube) collapsed 3D array converting ‘band’ dimension attributes. prepares data training TWDTW-1NN model.
code: tif_files <- dir(system.file("mato_grosso_brazil", package = "dtwSat"), pattern = "\\.tif$", full.names = TRUE)  acquisition_date <- as.Date(regmatches(tif_files, regexpr("[0-9]{8}", tif_files)), format = "%Y%m%d")  print(acquisition_date) ##  [1] "2011-09-14" "2011-09-30" "2011-10-16" "2011-11-01" "2011-11-17" ##  [6] "2011-12-03" "2011-12-19" "2012-01-01" "2012-01-17" "2012-02-02" ## [11] "2012-02-18" "2012-03-05" "2012-03-21" "2012-04-06" "2012-04-22" ## [16] "2012-05-08" "2012-05-24" "2012-06-09" "2012-06-25" "2012-07-11" ## [21] "2012-07-27" "2012-08-12" "2012-08-28" # read data-cube dc <- read_stars(tif_files,                  proxy = FALSE,                  along = list(time = acquisition_date),                  RasterIO = list(bands = 1:6))  # set band names dc <- st_set_dimensions(dc, 3, c("EVI", "NDVI", "RED", "BLUE", "NIR", "MIR"))  # convert band dimension to attribute dc <- split(dc, c("band"))  print(dc) ## stars object with 3 dimensions and 6 attributes ## attribute(s): ##         Min. 1st Qu. Median       Mean 3rd Qu.   Max. NA's ## EVI   0.0636  0.2350 0.3883 0.40567166  0.5367 0.9994    0 ## NDVI  0.1462  0.3855 0.6099 0.58831591  0.7849 0.9819    0 ## RED   0.0015  0.0419 0.0692 0.08195341  0.1119 0.4007    0 ## BLUE  0.0012  0.0216 0.0365 0.04992652  0.0617 0.4174    9 ## NIR   0.0582  0.2465 0.3024 0.32209612  0.3813 0.7246    0 ## MIR   0.0276  0.0966 0.1411 0.15764017  0.2104 0.4161    0 ## dimension(s): ##      from to   offset  delta                       refsys point ## x       1 37 -6089551  231.7 +proj=sinu +lon_0=0 +x_0=... FALSE ## y       1 27 -1332951 -231.7 +proj=sinu +lon_0=0 +x_0=... FALSE ## time    1 23       NA     NA                         Date    NA ##                         values x/y ## x                         NULL [x] ## y                         NULL [y] ## time 2011-09-14,...,2012-08-28

title: 1. Land use mapping using TWDTW-1NN and stars
text: addition mandatory arguments x (satellite data-cube) y (training samples), TWDTW distance calculation also requires setting cycle_length, time_scale, time_weight. details, refer documentation using ?twdtw. argument formula = band ~ s(time) optional. provided, training samples time sereis resampled using Generalized Additive Models (GAMs), collapsing samples land-use label single sample. reduces computational demands. sample model can visualized follows:
code: twdtw_model <- twdtw_knn1(x = dc,                           y = samples,                           cycle_length = 'year',                           time_scale = 'day',                           time_weight = c(steepness = 0.1, midpoint = 50),                           formula = band ~ s(time))  print(twdtw_model) ##  ## Model of class 'twdtw_knn1' ## ----------------------------- ## Call: ## twdtw_knn1(x = dc, y = samples, time_weight = c(steepness = 0.1,  ##     midpoint = 50), cycle_length = "year", time_scale = "day",  ##     formula = band ~ s(time)) ##  ## Formula: ## band ~ s(time) ##  ## Data: ## # A tibble: 5 × 2 ##   label          observations  ##   <chr>          <list>        ## 1 Cotton-fallow  <df [22 × 7]> ## 2 Forest         <df [22 × 7]> ## 3 Soybean-cotton <df [22 × 7]> ## 4 Soybean-millet <df [22 × 7]> ## 5 Soybean-maize  <df [22 × 7]> ##  ## TWDTW Arguments: ##  - time_weight: c(steepness=0.1, midpoint=50) ##  - cycle_length: year ##  - time_scale: day ##  - origin: NULL ##  - max_elapsed: Inf ##  - version: f90 plot(twdtw_model)

title: 1. Land use mapping using TWDTW-1NN and stars
text: Finally, predict land-use classes pixel location data-cube: ‘time’ dimension reduced single map. can now visualize using ggplot:  Note pixels (3x3 box) northeast part map NA values due missing value blue band recorded 2011-11-17. limitation addressed future versions dtwSat package. Ultimately, can write map TIFF file can use:
code: lu_map <- predict(dc, model = twdtw_model) print(lu_map) ## stars object with 2 dimensions and 1 attribute ## attribute(s): ##          prediction   ##  Cotton-fallow :149   ##  Forest        :196   ##  Soybean-cotton:203   ##  Soybean-maize :208   ##  Soybean-millet:234   ##  NA's          :  9   ## dimension(s): ##   from to   offset  delta                       refsys point x/y ## x    1 37 -6089551  231.7 +proj=sinu +lon_0=0 +x_0=... FALSE [x] ## y    1 27 -1332951 -231.7 +proj=sinu +lon_0=0 +x_0=... FALSE [y] ggplot() +   geom_stars(data = lu_map) +   theme_minimal() write_stars(lu_map, "lu_map.tif")

title: 1. Land use mapping using TWDTW-1NN and stars
text: introduction outlined use dtwSat land-use mapping. -depth information, refer papers Maus et al. (2016) Maus et al. (2019) twdtw R package documentation. additional details manage input output satellite images, check stars documentation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Victor Maus. Author, maintainer. Marius Appel. Contributor. Nikolas Kuschnig. Contributor. Toni Giorgino. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Maus V, Câmara G, Appel M, Pebesma E (2019). “dtwSat: Time-Weighted Dynamic Time Warping Satellite Image Time Series Analysis R.” Journal Statistical Software, 88(5), 1–31. doi:10.18637/jss.v088.i05. Maus V, Câmara G, Cartaxo R, Sanchez , Ramos F, de Queiroz G (2016). “Time-Weighted Dynamic Time Warping Method Land-Use Land-Cover Mapping.” Selected Topics Applied Earth Observations Remote Sensing, IEEE Journal , 9(8), 3729–3739. ISSN 1939-1404, doi:10.1109/JSTARS.2016.2517118.
code: @Article{,   title = {{dtwSat}: Time-Weighted Dynamic Time Warping for Satellite Image Time Series Analysis in {R}},   author = {Victor Maus and Gilberto C{\^a}mara and Marius Appel and Edzer Pebesma},   journal = {Journal of Statistical Software},   year = {2019},   volume = {88},   number = {5},   pages = {1--31},   doi = {10.18637/jss.v088.i05}, } @Article{,   title = {A Time-Weighted Dynamic Time Warping Method for Land-Use and Land-Cover Mapping},   author = {Victor Maus and Gilberto C{\^a}mara and Ricardo Cartaxo and Alber Sanchez and Fernando M. Ramos and Gilberto R. {de Queiroz}},   journal = {Selected Topics in Applied Earth Observations and Remote Sensing, IEEE Journal of},   year = {2016},   volume = {9},   number = {8},   pages = {3729--3739},   doi = {10.1109/JSTARS.2016.2517118},   issn = {1939-1404},   month = {Aug}, }

what: Time-Weighted Dynamic Time Warping for Satellite Image Time Series Analysis
title: Time-Weighted Dynamic Time Warping for Satellite Image Time Series Analysis
text: Provides robust approach land use mapping using multi-dimensional (multi-band) satellite image time series. leveraging Time-Weighted Dynamic Time Warping (TWDTW) distance metric tandem 1 Nearest-Neighbor (1-NN) Classifier, package offers functions produce land use maps based distinct seasonality patterns, commonly observed phenological cycles vegetation. approach described Maus et al. (2016) Maus et al. (2019). primary advantage TWDTW capability handle irregularly sampled noisy time series, also requiring minimal training sets. package includes tools training 1-NN-TWDTW model, visualizing temporal patterns, producing land use maps, visualizing results.

title: Time-Weighted Dynamic Time Warping for Satellite Image Time Series Analysis
text: can install dtwSat CRAN using following command: Alternatively, can install development version GitHub: installation, can read vignette quick start guide:
code: install.packages("dtwSat") devtools::install_github("vwmaus/dtwSat") vignette("landuse-mapping", "dtwSat")

what: Compute the Most Common Sampling Frequency across all observations — get_time_series_freq
title: Compute the Most Common Sampling Frequency across all observations — get_time_series_freq
text: function calculates common difference consecutive time points. can useful determining aproximate sampling frequency time series data.

title: Compute the Most Common Sampling Frequency across all observations — get_time_series_freq
code: get_time_series_freq(x)

title: Compute the Most Common Sampling Frequency across all observations — get_time_series_freq
text: x data frame including column called `observations`` time series

title: Compute the Most Common Sampling Frequency across all observations — get_time_series_freq
text: difftime object representing common time difference consecutive samples.

what: Plot Patterns from twdtw-knn1 model — plot.twdtw_knn1
title: Plot Patterns from twdtw-knn1 model — plot.twdtw_knn1
text: function visualizes time series patterns "twdtw_knn1" model. produces multi-faceted plot, facet represents different time series label model's data. Within facet, different bands indices (attributes) plotted distinct lines, differentiated color.

title: Plot Patterns from twdtw-knn1 model — plot.twdtw_knn1
code: # S3 method for twdtw_knn1 plot(x, bands = NULL, ...)

title: Plot Patterns from twdtw-knn1 model — plot.twdtw_knn1
text: x model class "twdtw_knn1". bands character vector specifying bands indices plot. NULL (default), available bands indices data plotted. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot. Currently used.

title: Plot Patterns from twdtw-knn1 model — plot.twdtw_knn1
text: ggplot object displaying time series patterns.

title: Plot Patterns from twdtw-knn1 model — plot.twdtw_knn1
code: if (FALSE) {  # Read training samples samples_path <-    system.file("mato_grosso_brazil/samples.gpkg", package = "dtwSat")  samples <- st_read(samples_path, quiet = TRUE)  # Get satellite image time sereis files tif_path <- system.file("mato_grosso_brazil", package = "dtwSat") tif_files <- dir(tif_path, pattern = "\\.tif$", full.names = TRUE)  # Get acquisition dates acquisition_date <- regmatches(tif_files, regexpr("[0-9]{8}", tif_files)) acquisition_date <- as.Date(acquisition_date, format = "%Y%m%d")  # Create a 3D datacube dc <- read_stars(tif_files,                  proxy = FALSE,                  along = list(time = acquisition_date),                  RasterIO = list(bands = 1:6)) dc <- st_set_dimensions(dc, 3, c("EVI", "NDVI", "RED", "BLUE", "NIR", "MIR")) dc <- split(dc, c("band"))  # Create a knn1-twdtw model m <- twdtw_knn1(x = dc,                 y = samples,                 cycle_length = 'year',                 time_scale = 'day',                 time_weight = c(steepness = 0.1, midpoint = 50),                 formula = band ~ s(time))  print(m)  # Visualize model patterns plot(m)  # Classify satellite images system.time(lu <- predict(dc, model = m))  # Visualise land use classification ggplot() +   geom_stars(data = lu) +   theme_minimal()  }

what: Predict using the twdtw_knn1 model — predict.twdtw_knn1
title: Predict using the twdtw_knn1 model — predict.twdtw_knn1
text: function predicts classes new data using Time Warped Dynamic Time Warping (TWDTW) method 1-nearest neighbor approach. prediction based minimum TWDTW distance known patterns stored twdtw_knn1 model.

title: Predict using the twdtw_knn1 model — predict.twdtw_knn1
code: # S3 method for twdtw_knn1 predict(object, newdata, ...)

title: Predict using the twdtw_knn1 model — predict.twdtw_knn1
text: object twdtw_knn1 model object generated twdtw_knn1 function. newdata data frame similar object containing new observations (time series data) predicted. ... Additional arguments passed twdtw function. provided, overwrite twdtw arguments previously passed twdtw_knn1.

title: Predict using the twdtw_knn1 model — predict.twdtw_knn1
text: vector predicted classes newdata.

title: Predict using the twdtw_knn1 model — predict.twdtw_knn1
code: if (FALSE) {  # Read training samples samples_path <-    system.file("mato_grosso_brazil/samples.gpkg", package = "dtwSat")  samples <- st_read(samples_path, quiet = TRUE)  # Get satellite image time sereis files tif_path <- system.file("mato_grosso_brazil", package = "dtwSat") tif_files <- dir(tif_path, pattern = "\\.tif$", full.names = TRUE)  # Get acquisition dates acquisition_date <- regmatches(tif_files, regexpr("[0-9]{8}", tif_files)) acquisition_date <- as.Date(acquisition_date, format = "%Y%m%d")  # Create a 3D datacube dc <- read_stars(tif_files,                  proxy = FALSE,                  along = list(time = acquisition_date),                  RasterIO = list(bands = 1:6)) dc <- st_set_dimensions(dc, 3, c("EVI", "NDVI", "RED", "BLUE", "NIR", "MIR")) dc <- split(dc, c("band"))  # Create a knn1-twdtw model m <- twdtw_knn1(x = dc,                 y = samples,                 cycle_length = 'year',                 time_scale = 'day',                 time_weight = c(steepness = 0.1, midpoint = 50),                 formula = band ~ s(time))  print(m)  # Visualize model patterns plot(m)  # Classify satellite images system.time(lu <- predict(dc, model = m))  # Visualise land use classification ggplot() +   geom_stars(data = lu) +   theme_minimal()  }

what: Prepare a Time Series Tibble from a 2D stars Object with Bands and Time Attributes — prepare_time_series
title: Prepare a Time Series Tibble from a 2D stars Object with Bands and Time Attributes — prepare_time_series
text: function reshapes data frame, converted stars object, nested wide tibble format. stars object conversion often results columns named formats like "band.YYYY.MM.DD", "XYYYY.MM.DD.band", "YYYY.MM.DD.band".

code: prepare_time_series(x)

text: x data frame derived stars object containing time series data wide format. column names adhere one following formats: "band.YYYY.MM.DD", "XYYYY.MM.DD.band", "YYYY.MM.DD.band".

title: Prepare a Time Series Tibble from a 2D stars Object with Bands and Time Attributes — prepare_time_series
text: nested tibble wide format. row tibble corresponds unique 'ts_id' maintains order original stars object. nested structure contains observations (time series) 'ts_id', including 'time' observation, individual bands presented separate columns.

what: Shift Dates to Start on a Specified Origin Year — shift_dates
title: Shift Dates to Start on a Specified Origin Year — shift_dates
text: Shifts vector dates start day--year specified origin year preserving relative difference days among observations. way temporal pattern (e.g., seasonality) inherent original dates also preserved shifted dates.

title: Shift Dates to Start on a Specified Origin Year — shift_dates
code: shift_dates(x, origin = "1970-01-01")

title: Shift Dates to Start on a Specified Origin Year — shift_dates
text: x vector date strings Date objects representing sequence shift. origin date string Date object specifying desired origin year shifted dates. Default "1970-01-01".

title: Shift Dates to Start on a Specified Origin Year — shift_dates
text: vector Date objects shifted dates starting day--year specified origin year.

title: Shift Dates to Start on a Specified Origin Year — shift_dates
text: primary goal function align sequence dates based day--year desired origin year. can particularly useful comparing visualizing two time series different absolute dates aiming align based day--year another relative metric.

title: Shift Dates to Start on a Specified Origin Year — shift_dates

what: Train a KNN-1 TWDTW model with optional GAM resampling — twdtw_knn1
title: Train a KNN-1 TWDTW model with optional GAM resampling — twdtw_knn1
text: function prepares KNN-1 model Time Warp Dynamic Time Warping (TWDTW) algorithm. formula provided, training samples resampled using Generalized Additive Models (GAM).

title: Train a KNN-1 TWDTW model with optional GAM resampling — twdtw_knn1
code: twdtw_knn1(   x,   y,   time_weight,   cycle_length,   time_scale,   formula = NULL,   start_column = "start_date",   end_column = "end_date",   label_colum = "label",   sampling_freq = NULL,   ... )

title: Train a KNN-1 TWDTW model with optional GAM resampling — twdtw_knn1
text: x three-dimensional stars object (x, y, time) bands attributes. y sf object coordinates training points. time_weight numeric vector length two (steepness midpoint logistic weight) function. See details twdtw. cycle_length length cycle, e.g. phenological cycles. Details twdtw. time_scale Specifies time scale observations. Details twdtw. formula Either NULL formula reduce samples label using Generalized Additive Models (GAM). Default band ~ s(time). See details. start_column Name column y indicates start date. Default 'start_date'. end_column Name column y indicates end date. Default 'end_date'. label_colum Name column y containing land use labels. Default 'label'. sampling_freq time frequency sampling, including unit (e.g., '16 day'). NULL, function infer frequency. parameter used formula provided. ... Additional arguments passed gam function twdtw function.

title: Train a KNN-1 TWDTW model with optional GAM resampling — twdtw_knn1
text: 'twdtw_knn1' model containing trained model information data used.

title: Train a KNN-1 TWDTW model with optional GAM resampling — twdtw_knn1
text: formula NULL, KNN-1 model retain training samples. formula passed (e.g., band ~ s(time)), samples label (land cover class) resampled using GAM. Resampling can significantly reduce prediction processing time.

title: Train a KNN-1 TWDTW model with optional GAM resampling — twdtw_knn1
code: if (FALSE) {  # Read training samples samples_path <-    system.file("mato_grosso_brazil/samples.gpkg", package = "dtwSat")  samples <- st_read(samples_path, quiet = TRUE)  # Get satellite image time sereis files tif_path <- system.file("mato_grosso_brazil", package = "dtwSat") tif_files <- dir(tif_path, pattern = "\\.tif$", full.names = TRUE)  # Get acquisition dates acquisition_date <- regmatches(tif_files, regexpr("[0-9]{8}", tif_files)) acquisition_date <- as.Date(acquisition_date, format = "%Y%m%d")  # Create a 3D datacube dc <- read_stars(tif_files,                  proxy = FALSE,                  along = list(time = acquisition_date),                  RasterIO = list(bands = 1:6)) dc <- st_set_dimensions(dc, 3, c("EVI", "NDVI", "RED", "BLUE", "NIR", "MIR")) dc <- split(dc, c("band"))  # Create a knn1-twdtw model m <- twdtw_knn1(x = dc,                 y = samples,                 cycle_length = 'year',                 time_scale = 'day',                 time_weight = c(steepness = 0.1, midpoint = 50),                 formula = band ~ s(time))  print(m)  # Visualize model patterns plot(m)  # Classify satellite images system.time(lu <- predict(dc, model = m))  # Visualise land use classification ggplot() +   geom_stars(data = lu) +   theme_minimal()  }

title: dtwSat v1.0.0
text: Dependency Updates: release removes obsolete dependencies, notably raster, rgdal, sp. Reduced Dependencies: significantly minimized number package dependencies streamline installation update process. Spatial Data Handling sf stars: Spatial data handling overhauled. ’ve introduced support sf stars packages enhance capability. Improved Workflow Compatibility: package now offers workflow aligns seamlessly prevalent image classification workflows.

title: dtwSat v0.2.8
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-11 Adds faster implementation TWDTW logistic weight function Fixes small bugs Adds vignettes

title: dtwSat v0.2.7
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-19 Adds support user defined TWDTW weight function Drop support parallel processing Adds minimalist function called twdtwReduceTime 3x faster twdtwApply. function can used high level parallel processing implemented users

title: dtwSat v0.2.6
text: CRAN release: 2020-03-02 Fixes error - : non-numeric argument binary operator “twdtwAssess” Fixes bug .twdtw fundtion Adds function fast time series classification “twdtw_reduce_time” (~3x faster twdtwApply)

title: dtwSat v0.2.5
text: CRAN release: 2019-01-27 Adds dtwSat paper published Journal Statistical Software Fixing bugs Fix error plotAccuracy Generalizes twdwAssess cases one map Fixes error getTimeSeries due time series one observation

title: dtwSat v0.2.4
text: CRAN release: 2018-05-25 New features Include function twdtwApplyParallel TWDTW parallel processing using package snow Include writeRaster twdtwRaster class Improve tests documentation Improve memory usage twdtwApply Improve memory usage speed twdtwClassify Auto recognition argument “doy” avoid naming argument “doy = doy” Fixing bugs Fix bug twdtwAssess class twdtwMatches Fix bug twdtwRaster

title: dtwSat v0.2.3
text: CRAN release: 2017-05-16 New features Register TWDTW distance function package proxy Fixing bugs Fix typos plot labels

title: dtwSat v0.2.2 Release Notes
text: CRAN release: 2017-03-31 New features New accuracy metrics (twdtwAssess) classified map, including User’s Producer’s accuracy, area uncertainty. Include methods accuracy visualization (plot LaTeX tables) Update data set names Rename data sets ordes avoid future overwriting functions data sets. “example_ts” replaced “MOD13Q1.ts”. Tthe data sets now called: MOD13Q1.MT.yearly.patterns Data: patterns time series MOD13Q1.patterns.list Data: patterns time series MOD13Q1.ts Data: example satellite time series MOD13Q1.ts.labels Data: Labels satellite time series MOD13Q1.ts MOD13Q1.ts.list Fixing bugs Fix bug twdtwApply wrong sign ‘’ argument Fix bug time index twdtwApply-twdtwRaster

title: dtwSat v0.2.1 Release Notes
text: CRAN release: 2016-07-19 Fix Solaris installation errors.

title: dtwSat v0.2.0 Release Notes
text: CRAN release: 2016-07-10 Include Fortran optimization version includes functions written Fortran. Obsolete features S4 class ‘twdtw’ longer exists. New features New S4 classes: twdtwTimeSeries, twdtwMatches, twdtwRaster. plot methods twdtwRaster object: ‘maps’, ‘area’, ‘changes’, ‘distance’. plot methods twdtwTimeSeries objects: ‘’patterns’’ ‘’timeseries’’. plot methods twdtwMatches objects: ‘’paths’‘,’‘matches’‘,’‘alignments’‘,’‘classification’‘,’‘cost’‘,’‘patterns’‘, ’‘timeseries’’. createPattern function create temporal patterns based set time series. getTimeSeries extract time series raster objects. twdtwApply apply TWDTW analysis raster time series objects.

title: dtwSat v0.1.1 Release Notes
text: New features ‘normalizeQuery’ new normalization feature TWDTW ‘template.list’ new dataset. List template time series arguments ‘’ ‘’ ‘classifyIntervals’ updated include ‘character’ ‘Dates’ format ‘yyyy-mm-dd’ Align query template name names null ‘twdtw’ function deprecated features argument ‘x’ function ‘waveletSmoothing’ deprecated scheduled removed next version. Please use ‘timeseries’ instead. argument ‘template’ functions ‘twdtw’ ‘mtwdtw’ deprecated scheduled removed next version. Please use ‘timeseries’ instead. argument ‘normalized’ deprecated scheduled removed next version methods ‘createTimeSequence’ deprecated. Use ‘getModisTimeSequence’ instead. Fix function name. ‘classfyIntervals’ deprecated. Use ‘classifyIntervals’ instead. Fixing bugs Fix plot intervals plotClassify replace range(x) range(x, na.rm=TRUE) methods Bug fixed cost matrix indexing

title: dtwSat v0.1.0 Release Notes
text: CRAN release: 2015-10-10 First version dtwSat CRAN
